definition: many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
good (virtuous)/benevolent/well-disposed/good at sth/to improve or perfect
to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~

sentences.english: I think you should just admit that you're a big softy .
sentences.chinese: 呃，我覺得你得承認自己挺多愁善感。

sentences.english: If they overdo it, then we say they are sentimental.
sentences.chinese: 如果他們做的過分了，我們就說他們很多愁善感。

sentences.english: Emotionalism and sentimentality prevent the sensitivity of feeling.
sentences.chinese: 多愁善感和感情用事妨礙了感覺的敏銳。

sentences.english: I don't want to go on loving sentimentally any more like now. I want my friendship.
sentences.chinese: 我不想再這樣多愁善感地愛下去，我要我的友誼。

sentences.english: Although sometimes some woman. she inside, but is a little sentimentality.
sentences.chinese: 雖然有時也有些大大咧咧，但是內心卻有點多愁善感。

sentences.english: I am a delicate girl in bone, maybe it is the only springhead.
sentences.chinese: 我骨子裏就是個多愁善感的女孩，這是唯一的根源。

sentences.english: That sentimental girl likes to pick up the fallen petals on the ground in autumn.
sentences.chinese: 那個多愁善感的女孩喜歡在秋天裏拾起地上的落英。

sentences.english: While she is much weak, she also grovels in sentimentality.
sentences.chinese: 她身體瀛弱，而且多愁善感。

sentences.english: Men of feeling may at any moment be killed outright by the iniquitous and the callous.
sentences.chinese: 多愁善感的人會立即被罪惡的人和無情的人徹底消滅。

sentences.english: That is part of what I mean by sentimentality.
sentences.chinese: 這就是我說的多愁善感的一部分。

sentences.english: He has a strong dislike for the sentimental.
sentences.chinese: 他非常討厭多愁善感無病呻吟。

sentences.english: Anna: Why do you become so maudlin ?
sentences.chinese: 你爲何變得如此多愁善感？

sentences.english: Here is the pretty official groveling in sentimentality.
sentences.chinese: 這位體面的官員沉溺於多愁善感之中。

sentences.english: The Israelis have no time for sentimentality about Bethlehem either.
sentences.chinese: 以色列人也沒時間因爲伯利恆而多愁善感。
因爲你偶爾的多愁善感。

definition: lit. looking at one's shadow and feeling sorry for oneself (idiom)/fig. alone and dejected
to worry about personal gains and losses
to be good at understanding others (idiom)
